headline: Anatomy Practice Starring Beowulf - Arms Edition

attachment.altText: Fanart of the Character Beowulf from the fighting game Skullgirls. He is shirtless and flexing his arms upwards while looking to the viewer with a smug on his face.

markdown.content: About the Art

<div style="text-align: justify; position: relative">The main purpose of this piece was to put on practice all the anatomy studies I have been doing lately. Since I got some anatomy books as a gift, I have been learning a lot!

My process of study consist in learing a new muscle, drawing it alone in multiples angles and sizes, and then fitting it on a full member *√©corch√©[^1]*. To be honest, I haven't practiced the torso as much as I wanted before I dived into the arms and their roots, but it was good enough. Regarding the arms, I wanted to give a highlight to those little muscles that are often hidden by the skin, the brachial and the coracobrachialis (both under the biceps), and exaggerate the muscles shapes, like in the triceps. And for that I couldn't have drawn anyone but my favorite wrestler Beowulf.

I thought of making a more complex and interesting perspective/composition, but I felt that it would be a bigger step that I can't take yet. Regarding colors and texture, I'm actually quite satisfied with the result I achieved! Usually I tend to render more than I'd like (because of zooming in too much), which makes the brush texture irrelevent. But in this one I achieved a level of texture that I enjoy a lot! Another challenge was making a colder palette than I'm normally used too. Lately I've noticed that I use a lot of orange in my paintings, and I wanted to try something different. I wouldn't say that I made huge differences to my previous palettes, but I'm happy I was able to use more purple and pale colours in a consistent color scheme.
Thanks for reading and expect more fanart of my man! :D üê±‚ÅâÔ∏è
